page.title: 11Hendon Rd. in the 1930's 1
page.content: Hendon Road in the 1930's was a very busy place.Shops lined both sides of the road. Ralphy Johnson was a well known character.He owned a rag shop.He bought old rags for 2d. a bundle.There was a Co-Operative store.Their saying was'We look after you from birth to burial'.For every pound spent in the shop you were given a dividend of 6d.There were several grocers.These included Kemps and the London & Newcastle Tea Co. In the 1930's flour was 1/10d. a stone bacon was 1/1d.a pound.There were pork shops and butchers.Also an important place was the Pawn Shop.During the Depression people pawned goods.When they could afford to they bought them back,but had to pay interest. {CONT. on page 12. }
